# Cambridge International AS & A Level  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 170, 250]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 210, 905, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/32  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 310, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 380, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 92, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 143, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
By sketching a suitable pair of graphs, show that the equation \(\cot 2x = \sec x\) has exactly one root in the interval \(0 < x < \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 110]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 497, 146, 515]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 496, 688, 515]]<|/det|>
Show that if a sequence of real values given by the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 521, 591, 549]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \frac{1}{2}\tan^{-1}(\cos x_{n})\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 555, 551, 575]]<|/det|>
converges, then it converges to the root in part **(a)**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 555, 920, 574]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 752, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(5^{x} = 5^{x + 2} - 10\). Give your answer correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 71, 430, 88]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(u\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 100, 598, 139]]<|/det|>
\[u = \frac{(\cos\frac{1}{7}\pi + \mathrm{i}\sin\frac{1}{7}\pi)^4}{\cos\frac{1}{7}\pi - \mathrm{i}\sin\frac{1}{7}\pi}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 153, 384, 171]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\arg u\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 153, 920, 171]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 520, 186, 537]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 518, 673, 537]]<|/det|>
The complex numbers \(u\) and \(u^{*}\) are plotted on an Argand diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 547, 920, 581]]<|/det|>
Describe the single geometrical transformation that maps \(u\) onto \(u^{*}\) and state the exact value of \(\arg u^{*}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 562, 920, 581]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[282, 84, 712, 285]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 301, 918, 352]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(ay = b^x\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(x\) is a straight line passing through the points (0.50, 2.24) and (3.40, 8.27), as shown in the diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 363, 692, 382]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\). Give each value correct to 1 significant figure.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 363, 918, 382]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\tan^3 2\theta + 2\tan 4\theta - \tan 2\theta = 0\) for \(0 < \theta < \pi\). Give your answers in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 430, 89]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 100, 601, 121]]<|/det|>
\[x = \tan^{2}2t,\quad y = \cos 2t,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 248, 152]]<|/det|>
for \(0 < t < \frac{1}{4}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 160, 144, 180]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 160, 371, 180]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = -\frac{1}{2}\cos^3 2t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 163, 917, 181]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Hence find the equation of the normal to the curve at the point where \(t = \frac{1}{8}\pi\). Give your answer in the form \(y = mx + c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 71, 755, 91]]<|/det|>
With respect to the origin \(O\), the points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) have position vectors given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 98, 688, 153]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = \left( \begin{array}{c}2\\ 1\\ -3 \end{array} \right),\quad \overrightarrow{OB} = \left( \begin{array}{c}0\\ 4\\ 1 \end{array} \right)\quad \mathrm{and}\quad \overrightarrow{OC} = \left( \begin{array}{c} - 3\\ - 2\\ 2 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 163, 146, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 653, 183]]<|/det|>
The point \(D\) is such that \(ABCD\) is a trapezium with \(\overrightarrow{DC} = 3\overrightarrow{AB}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 195, 390, 214]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(D\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 197, 920, 215]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 537, 186, 555]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 537, 584, 555]]<|/det|>
The diagonals of the trapezium intersect at the point \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 567, 386, 586]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 567, 920, 586]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
A balloon in the shape of a sphere has volume \(V\) and radius \(r\). Air is pumped into the balloon at a constant rate of \(40\pi\) starting when time \(t = 0\) and \(r = 0\). At the same time, air begins to flow out of the balloon at a rate of \(0.8\pi r\). The balloon remains a sphere at all times.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 144, 151]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 541, 152]]<|/det|>
Show that \(r\) and \(t\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 156, 551, 190]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}r}{\mathrm{d}t} = \frac{50 - r}{5r^2}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 163, 920, 181]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 536, 186, 554]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 536, 650, 554]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient and remainder when \(5r^2\) is divided by \(50-r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 536, 920, 554]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 104, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 75, 314, 107]]<|/det|>
Let \(\mathrm {f}(x)=\frac {2\mathrm {e}^{2x}}{\mathrm {e}^{2x}-3\mathrm {e}^{x}+2}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 128, 146, 147]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 127, 915, 163]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathrm {f}^{\prime }(x)\) and hence find the exact coordinates of the stationary point of the curve with equation \(y=\mathrm {f}(x).\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 144, 915, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 146, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 828, 104]]<|/det|>
Use the substitution \(u = \mathrm{e}^{x}\) and partial fractions to find the exact value of \(\int_{\ln 3}^{\ln 5} \mathrm{f}(x) \mathrm{d}x\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 110, 816, 131]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in the form \(\ln a\), where \(a\) is a rational number in its simplest form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 112, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
